author: jt.aussiegingersnap
title: Self Governed Gaming [Revelar+Duo]
description: Identify verification and asset ownership confirmation in NFT games can be facilitated with decentralized IDs.

f6_assessments.q0: Yes, this proposal effectively addresses the challenge, and if funded could provide a good impact for the Cardano community. Gaming is a major industry that is constantly evolving. The introduction of collectable NFTs and p2e games will only increase as the blockchain technology continues to grow. By integrating Atala Prism into the gaming engine Revelar, players and developers alike can maximize on the data-protected individual sovereignty offered by Cardano. If successful, this proposal could also accelerate adoption of Atala Prism to other game engines and make Cardano the go-to DID solution in gaming. By essentially developing a "how-to" guide other community members would also be able to adapt and apply the knowledge learned to their own games, creating an iterative development loop.
f6_assessments.q1: Yes, given the experience and plan presented it is highly likely that the proposal will be implemented successfully. The revelar game engine is already up and running providing an excellent use case to integrate Atala Prism into gaming, and increasing the feasibility of the project being successful. The team does a good job at outlining the exact steps that will be required and presents clear milestones on the path to achieve their objectives. I am would have liked to see more of the technical details on what is required to integrate Atala Prism into the game engine, but as the budget is so low it seems implied that it will not be too significant. Voters may feel more confident in the feasibility given that the dev team is not requesting funding to learn Atala Prism but instead in only requesting funds for what it will deliver back to the community. This implies an extra level of commitment as it represents the longest component of the timeline.
f6_assessments.q2: Yes, the information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and success of the proposal. The proposers do a good job at highlighting the problem and proposing a solution to accelerate the adoption of DIDs. They also provide clear milestones and KPIs which the community will be able to track and measure. The three deliverables included (Community article on how to incorporate Atala into a game; Community article on testing results found; and Published use case for asset verification in a game) are all tangible documents which will be subject to community scrutiny, meaning that their completion can be indicated by a yes/no. In addition, by including a "public delivery date" voters can also have confidence that they will be able to easily know if the project and its components were completed by the deadline.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal is intriguing, yet I fail to see the benefits of adding the DID & Atala PRISM layer in-between NFTs and gaming platforms. The authenticity of NFTs can even now be anonymously checked by verifying the policy ID, therefore game developers don't necessarily need DID for this service. As for the issue of tying assets to players and not wallets, on the cnft.io marketplace, for example, a single user can add several wallets on his account and list any NFTs from any of the linked wallets and remain anonymous, as there is no personal data exchanged between the user and the marketplace at any moment.
The only point to which I agree that DID would indeed be a valuable asset is for the age verification process, as that would add an extra layer of anonymity to the players.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team has been honest in the skills they have and the ones they don't have. They have planned on allocating time to learn Atala in the proposal, for which they have asked for no funds.
Yet the team composition and the skills needed to successfully complete the project have not been described. If training devs to learn Atala costs $0, then who are those devs and why will they be volunteering their time?
The scope of the proposal is not too grand and neither is the budget, and while I am not completely convinced about all the use-cases they have detailed, I can see it being an experiment worth taking.
f6_assessments.q2: While the budget is splitted into 2 main parts, I would have liked to know more what exactly each part means and what they have estimated for. Also, is there any risk related to the project, that could hinder its success and what would that success look like? Otherwise, the timeline presented, together with the budget and plan details offer just enough information to consider that the proposal can be assessed by the community.
f6_assessments.reply: CNFT.io still containerizes this functionality within a traditional login form with user data being stored somewhere. A DID would remove this burden of storage from the game and place it on-chain. A DID would anonymously identify a player without requiring a login.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal correctly identifies the challenge and aims  to accelerate DID adoption through gamification. The project clearly defines how it will bring value to the Cardano ecosystem by
f6_assessments.q1: Both team members are active within the community and DUO is already an NFT based game. It would be good to see potential pitfalls discussed, for example the delay of the Atala SDK. The funds requested and timeline to achieve this seem reasonable and well thought out.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal proposes to work on Identify verification and asset ownership confirmation in NFT games by making use of decentralized IDs. This falls into the challenge brief - develop solutions and implement with Atala PRISM and Cardano to have the most positive impact on the Cardano network.
f6_assessments.q1: The budget is set out very basic, and only 5000 USD is asked for. The team of two seams to have the necessary skills. Links are provided to their LinkedIn pages. There is a detailed report on the problem they are trying to solve and then they explain how they want to do it. They have given a timeline total 18 weeks with a brief description of what is to happen when. The proposal needs a bit more actionable tasks, and detail around implementation. No KPI's are set out.
f6_assessments.q2: Community members will be able to follow the project when proposer place a community article. It seems to lack enough Auditability. How when and where will these articles be placed? You have a good idea but need to give more details around KPI's, and maybe a clear road map and actionable tasks.
f6_assessments.reply:
Atala prism is bleeding-edge technology within the Cardano ecosystem. The idea of this proposal is to figure out what would be required to implement it into a gaming environment and then make that available to the community via 2 articles and a published use-case. That is also the reason the funding requested is so low. 
Detailed KPIs linked to design level decisions are near impossible to figure out, especially since the Atala Pioneer resources are not even yet available. Our test-case is planned within our Discord server for Duo, our flag-ship game, which is open to anybody. 
The burden of auditability requested by the reviewer seems very high, especially given the small amount of technical information available about Atala.

solution: Using Atala PRISM assets can be tied to players instead of wallets and the anonymous nature of the blockchain ecosystem is maintained.
